Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Hari R
Reviews.Content: This is hotel is perfectly located in the French Quarter. It is within walking distance to everything that you want to do in the area but far enough so that it is relatively quiet. It's an older hotel but quite charming.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Accommodations in NOLA!”
Reviews.Author: TheDriftWoods24477
Reviews.Content: We had the best stay at Hotel de la Monnaie! It is close enough to the French Quarter, yet removed enough to be peaceful! Close to Frenchman Street and the French Market. The room was a one bedroom with a living room, and galley style kitchen. Perfect for morning coffee and cereal. The balconies overlooking the courtyard an wading pool were very nice, and gave my husband a place to smoke conveniently outside. The staff, especially Camille, was very helpful, especially arranging a bus tour for us. We will definitely stay here again if we return to NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lucynoelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the week of June 22, 2012. We had a 2 bedroom unit on the 5th floor which was very nice. It is on the outskirts of the French Quarter, an ideal location traveling with kids, no loud partying outside at night. The trolley is basicly across the street & the French Market a 2 minute walk. Plenty of options for meals/music in the area. I was worried that I had made a mistake bring an 11 & 12 year old to New Orleans, no reason to worry- it is very family friendly! The hotel pool looks really small in the photos they have online, but it wasn't bad. The kids were able to swim in it & enjoyed it. Free parking in the basement of the hotel was a definite plus! Front Desk staff were very helpful & HK staff were very good. I left a fleece throw blanket behind & called to see if it was found, they offered to mail it back to me free of charge which I thought was very nice. If I head back to New Orleans in the future will definitely try to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beth S
Reviews.Content: This quiet lil hotel is walking distance to the action of the French Quarter, but has a small community feel. It is one block from the Farmers Market, one block from Frenchman street with local Jazz clubs. This hotel is our favorite, must stay place, prices are reasonable, and the rooms are a decent size with a living room, kitchen and bedroom, 1 - 2 bedrooms. Inside terrace overlooking fountain or pool, you really feel safe and secure! They also have off street parking free for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for your visit”
Reviews.Author: wlk902
Reviews.Content: Like just about every other review has said, this location is great. This was our first trip to New Orleans and we had no idea what to expect - how far the hotel would be from where we wanted to visit, etc., and were very happily surprised. We arrived about 4 hours before check in and since our room was ready they let us check in. That truly allowed us to start our vacation the morning we arrived. We booked this as an exchange through Interval. The room was a 1 Br unit on the front of the building which was very quiet. The only noise we could hear inside was the occasional train going along the river. The rooms are not super large, but very clean and comfortable. Queen size bed in the bdrms with good closet and dresser storage, small sofa, table and chairs in the living room. The bath was kept very clean and the toiletries were of nice quality. The kitchenette is small but functional and had adequate glasses, etc. Ice manchine on each floor is very convenient. We loved the balcony on the 2nd floor overlooking Esplanade. At night you can hear music from the local clubs and relax with your drinks, there was seldom more than 2 other guests, if any, out there. There are also "inside" balconies" outside each room that are really kind of neat with tables and chairs. These open atrium type hallways look down at the little splash pool or a garden. There is also a nice excercise room in the hotel. The walk to the French Market was about 3 minutes long, about the same to the streetcar stop. With the exception of one employee who took nasty to a whole new level, the staff is super nice and helpful. Housekeeping kept the room tidy and were quick to get you something you may need. If you want super fancy accomodations in the middle of the bars this may not be for you. But if you want clean, comfortable rooms with a great location I would not recommend anything else. If we return to NOLA, this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect location and style”
Reviews.Author: Debra M
Reviews.Content: this timeshare exchange was great! the apt style suite was a unique layout wrapping in a semicircle around the courtyard center on 4th floor overlooking the wading pool- windows looking out from each separate room into courtyard and from the bedroom to the front street. Somewhat dated, but charming no less for it. Directly across from the old Mint where festivals are hosted. Great location for walking the French Quarter as well as distance touring, with the public transport streetcar stop right across the street. Despite the ongoing rainfall since we arrived, we are enjoying this trip so far. Friendly staff, but if you already own a TS, avoid the salespitch which will come in the initial form of a 'message waiting' on your room phone.

Reviews.Title: “Best buy in town !!”
Reviews.Author: RobertLevenson
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in this hotel every year for the last few, and always have a great time there. Every room is a suite, with a kitchenette and whirlpool bath...excellent location, and the rates are relatively low. It's furnished with English/European antiques, which adds to it's charm. It's actually a timeshare property, but our experience is that rooms are always available for short-term guests. We heartily recommend this spot to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter Fest Hot Spot”
Reviews.Author: Zonker123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the French Quarter Fest and it is absolutely the best for this since one of the music stages is right across the street. You can watch the bands (and people) from a large patio/balcony. Some of the hotel is a timeshare and lots of "owners" pretty much hung out there the whole time. Very friendly bunch of folks! Hotel was very nice and airy. I loved the small pool with the fountain. We booked a double bedroom suite. Had a cute kitchenette, living room and dining table. We were in #307 and we got it through VRBO. Very pleased with the room for the price. Room was quiet and clean. Had a coffee maker with community coffee, glassware, silverware, plates, even pots and pans. Our room had a jacuzzi tub for the bath. The best part of the being here is the location. You are right at the corner of Frenchmen St. and Decatur. The French Market is right there and you are in the middle of everything. The only bad thing was parking. Yes, they do have free indoor parking but only like a dozen spaces. We were lucky one night to get in there. Because of the festival, there was absolutely no parking all weekend. I had to park the car about 10 blocks away. I wasn't really worried about it but still would be nice to have something closer. Be careful where you park, the police do not fool around. One day, I saw a line of cars with tickets on them. Another day, they booted and towed the car that was parked ahead of me, but too close to the corner. Overall, I would stay there again. Very family friendly place. Great for the kids!! All the staff were very friendly and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Stephen H
Reviews.Content: Came for the Final Four and location made transit via the trolley to Canal and the Superdome shuttles very easy. The kitchenettes were very convenient and made restaurant leftover consumption simple. The laundromat in the garage was definitely a plus and allowed us to reduce our luggage mass. The front desk personnel were very helpful in arranging sightseeing tours on our tournament off-days. The only negative was a non functional shower. Even with a limited 30 gallon heater, it only put out cold water ALL the time. It was impossible to turn off, even when taking baths. It was mentioned to the front desk, but was never resolved during our stay. We had planned to stay an additional day after the tournament, but moved to a larger hotel within the quarter. There we took the first normal shower of our NOLA trip. I would stay here again, but only if the shower works.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect home base”
Reviews.Author: Gretchen S
Reviews.Content: I went with a group of really fun women for a birthday weekend and we loved this place! We split 2 rooms, which was plenty for sleeping but the living space in one was really cramped. But the location was just perfect to get to the market, streetcar (which goes right by the casino!), around the corner from Frenchman St. for live music (fun!) and Decatur St. for lots of shopping & great food. The hotel and our rooms were really clean and all the staff were great and super helpful. We did not have any hot water issues that others mentioned. Only bad thing was we never knew about the gorgeous 2nd floor balcony until the day before we left. We would have spent our mornings there for sure. Will go to this hotel again.....soon I hope!

Reviews.Title: “QJust as wonderful as we remembered!”
Reviews.Author: sunsalAnnapolis_MD
Reviews.Content: We returned to Hotel de la Monnaie (and New Orleans) in January for the first time since Hurricane Katrina, and were a little worried that it had gone downhill since our stay about 7 years ago based, in part, on some reviews posted here. Our last visit included two teenagers who didn't really want to be traveling with their parents, and we were thrilled then to find a place with separate bedrooms and a living area within walking distance to everything. Now the kids are grown and it was just me and my husband for a romantic birthday trip for two. We didn't need a "kid-friendly" place and I wondered if I should have looked elsewhere before booking. My worries were needless. We loved this place just as much now as we did years ago. Yes, it's a little shabbier and the furniture is dated. But the front desk staff is just as helpful, and the interior courtyards are just as stunning. Having a full suite -- living/kitchen area, separate bedroom, separate bathroom -- is a real luxury for even two guests. Where can you get all that in the French Quarter for $144/night?! We loved being able to heat up leftovers for breakfast/lunch or prepare snacks in the kitchen, and it's nice having a separate bedroom when you're spending more than one night in a place. There's soft and ample lighting, comfortable sofa and chairs, and it's just really cozy. We didn't hear any night noise, either from nearby bars and restaurants or from within the hotel. In fact the hotel seems pretty insulated from the surrounding businesses. But it's really about location, location, location. Walk out the door, cross the street and you're in the French Market (one of those stalls sells the best bloody mary in the world!). We walked the French Quarter from one side to the other many times. We walked along the river, from the hotel to the big cruise ships docked by the Convention Center. We took the free ferry across the river. We grabbed the streetcar across the street for a trip to the garden district. Although we rented a car, we left it in the garage the whole time we were there. Next time we'll take a cab. There was just no reason to leave the neighborhood because we barely scratched the surface of what we could reach on foot in four full days. Our biggest surprise was the change to Frenchmen Street, just around the corner. On our last visit, this location on the fringe of the FQ was bordering the seedy side of town. Imagine our surprise when we arrived on this trip and the front desk clerk recommended a restaurant on Frenchman Street! We walked around the corner and heard live music coming out of every door, saw cabs dropping visitors off to trendy restaurants, and walked several blocks of lively, local, thriving nightlife scene. Incredible! No gigantic plastic neon drink glasses, no beads, no hawkers, no gawking tourists. Just great music, good food, and really positive energy. During our visit we spent a lot of time in the typical tourist areas of the FQ, but always appreciated returning to the authenticity of our hotel and the Frenchmen Street neighborhood. In summary, would I recommend this hotel to everyone? No. If you want a fancy highrise hotel with a big, glittery lobby, stay near the convention center. If you want a cute B & B with Victorian furniture and personal attention, find another place. But if you want a cozy, comfortable suite in charming hotel in a real neighborhood at a great price, this is the best! We had such a great visit, and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Booked through RCI, and would do again.”
Reviews.Author: wigginsamerica
Reviews.Content: Here are the great things, here are the bad things: 1. GOOD- Location! Close to everything in the French Quarter. 2. GOOD- Clean. Nice place. 3. GOOD- Parking. In the french quarter, parking is a premium, and to stay at a place with it's own parking garage is a huge plus. We never had an issue getting parking. 4. GOOD- Transportation- you can walk the entire French Quarter OR the streetcar stop is right next door if you want to go to other parts of the city. 5. BAD- Size. Since we booked through RCI, the room was probably the smallest they had. But not the end of the world. 6. BAD- Noise. We're not big up-all-night people, so the music at the club next door was not good for sleep. Plus there were rattling air ducts and stuff like that in the room. If the club has hip-hop, be ready for a long night of bass bass bass and your earplugs don't block bass. 7. NEUTRAL- the staff was relatively friendly, and the amenities were okay. There's a pool but you probably won't use it, because it's a also a fountain and seems better for kids. A computer in the lobby with internet, and some books and plenty of maps.

Reviews.Title: “Big Easy was a bit squeezy.”
Reviews.Author: wilderkin
Reviews.Content: Very nice little hotel with friendly staff, in the perfect location at the end of the streetcar line, and looking over the Mississippi from our bedroom albeit lying on the bed to see out. Had to walk sideways to get around the tres bijou apartment but enjoyed the stay. When we checked out we were told that we could have changed rooms! C'est la vie! Great city though with lots to see and do, and great food, nice people and free music everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “you wanna be HERE!”
Reviews.Author: carole8772745
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel is that 1. it is across the street from the street car system, which travels all over! 2. You can easily walk (or ride the street car)to world famous CafÃ© du Monde for a breakfast of hot beinets & coffee OR walk one block down Decateur Street for a fantastic breakfast at "Envie". 3. Great music/club scene on Frenchman street, right next to Hotel de la Monnaie, so you don't have to walk far to get home if you want to stay out late listening to live jazz. Check out upstairs at Snug Harbor or Spotted Cat or BMC, all on Frenchman Street. After the first shower, we noticed that our tub was clogged up. As soon as we called front desk to report the problem, a maintenance man was up and fixed it. The two bedroom unit was clean, with a comfortable sitting room. Master bedroom was nice, with large closet & bureau for storage. The second bedroom was really tiny, no windows. Storage closet was outside the room, Bed not so great, pillows not so great. If you can, bring your own pillows. The furniture was a bit shabby and mismatched but we were not there for the decor!! Yellow walls in the unit were cheerful, and the art on the walls was all on New Orleans events which I liked.Our favorite thing was the deep whirlpool bathtub ! We took fantastic bubble baths with the jacuzzi jets humming every night. There was a plaque on the bathtub wall warning us that the hot water tank held 30 gallons only. There were 4 adults in our party, and we never ran out of hot water. We just were careful not to take 4 showers in a row. We staggered our use. The deep compfy bathtub filled right to the top with hot water. The important thing is that all of the wonders & delights of the French Quarter are so close by:) We could go anywhere from Hotel de la Monnaie easily. The staff were very friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in the French Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: hellozombies
Reviews.Content: I and my five friends had a wonderful time at this hotel for three nights/four days in June 2011. We stayed in one of the two-bedroom suites and it was perfect--a good size for all six of us, plus a nice bathroom. It was clean and comfortable, and the best part is that we weren't charged for extra people, which was really nice for us since we were on a budget. And also, the price was REALLY fantastic, and I know that I'll stay there next time, without a doubt. Definitely a wonderful stay and an absolutely beautiful hotel. Great location, super easy to walk all around the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: Rustler2010
Reviews.Content: Well appointed, clean, condominium style hotel, living room, bedroom(s), kitchenette, bath. Many rooms have whirlpool baths. We loved it and have stayed here for several Mardi Gras now after staying at A Hotel-The Frenchmen just up the road for many years. We do miss the small outdoor pool and hot tub at the Frenchmen, but Hotel de la Monnaie is quiet, accommodating and refined; at the edge of the Quarter, close enough, but yet far enough away from the Mardi Gras festivities. Our only criticism is that each unit has it's own, small, hot water heater. One hot shower or bath depletes the hot water supply very quickly and the electric heater unit takes quite a while to replenish hot water. I understand that some units have newer, more modern On-Demand hot water systems, but we have never had one of those. Free parking, although we never took the car out of the garage once we arrived. This hotel is old and quaint enough in decor, yet has all the modern conveniences to satisfy your visit to New Orleans. The condo style arrangement is great for TV viewing, relaxing and entertaining when others prefer to retire for the evening; not the confinement of a single room hotel.

Reviews.Title: “September in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: saturn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from New Orleans and stayed at the Hotel de la Monnaie. It was very accommodating. People were very friendly and helpful in assisting you with places in the area.Location was the key close to open market, the trolly and Bourbon street. We would recommend this Hotel, no frills but a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: PandB033
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a week on an RCI exchange. Had a one bedroom apartment which was clean, but very small with quite dated furnishings. They had some nicer units, but they were occupied as we arrived on the weekend of a Saints home game. Staff were all very helpful. The best thing of all was the location. Frenchman street with all it's music clubs is just around the corner, the trolly stop is across the street, and the French Market just a block away. Parking is always a problem in the French Quarter area, but this hotel had it's own parking garage and it was free. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable...Will not be back”
Reviews.Author: ZinnHouston
Reviews.Content: I don't understand this place...room was extremely outdated with mismatched and broken furniture; tv; stove and refrigerator. Carpet was burgundy/green--(dirty and stained--needs to be ripped out) and tile of kitchen didn't match bathroom tile. Mold in bathroom--needs deep cleaning. Bed worn out and dirty box spring/mattress. Drapes outdated--old paneling on walls--nothing matched--mismatched chairs/sofa/tables. furniture was painful to look at--lamps didn't work. Room was dark and depressing--couldn't tell if I was in outdated national park lodging or French Quarter...Bates motel? Dirty ashtrays and outdated magazines throughout hotel...no complimentary coffee in lobby (basic). Dirty parking garage--but safe. Whole place needs power washing. ONLY plus is that it is located near French Market and Frenchmen Street. Way not worth the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: kathy_rodgers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 6 days with a group of friends in a 2 bedroom apartment. The location is on the edge of the French Quarter within walking distance of all the places to see. There is also a tram across the street if you dont want to walk. The hotel was comfortable and we managed with 2 double bedrooms and a sofa bed in the lounge. The people on reception were helpful and everyone was friendly. We were there towards the end of the annual Jazz Fest and loved New Orleans with so much to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Tracy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to New Orleans and stay at Hotel de La Monnaie. The location is great right on the border between the French Quarter and the Marigny. The music clubs of Frenchman street are just a block away, as is the French Market. The Riverfront streetcar line was down for repairs the entire week we were there so that made for a good bit of additional walking. The staff was very friendly and helpful all during the week. The facilities are a little out of date and not quite on the par with other timeshares we have stayed at in other places; i.e only one bathroom in a two bedroom unit. The rooks are big for a hotel but smaller than most timeshare units. Compared to other time share places in New Orleans the staff was much friendlier here, the location can't be beat, and NO rodents! The pool is pretty small but the Courtyards are nice. Parking is free but space is limited. Pay parking is right behind the hotel so if you can't get a space it's not a major issue. The kitchenette is really small and cramped and we only really used it on a very limited basis. The Hotel has a guest laundry in the parking garage but there is only 1 washer and 1 dryer. You may want to ask for a room that does not face the Dragon's Den club if your a light sleeper. Bottom line: if you want a clean, nice, hotel, with a pleasant staff, and a great location to explore New Orleans then give this place a try. If you are looking for a luxurious gold crown level time share resort you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience - AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: CoolmanRobm007
Reviews.Content: This is the best location, great staff and more than ample living space!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: rosa7of11
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de la Monnaie is located within walking distance to the French Market and many of the worthwhile sites to see in New Orleans. Don't feel like walking? Well then you are in luck because the Riverwalk Streetcar is a few steps away from the hotel's front door. The hotel is old but is cozy and clean. Parking is limited to only 22 spots, but you can parking parking on the side streets around the hotel. The bedroom is small and the bed, although they say they are queen size, I beg to differ they are more full size. Their is a small courtyard with a small pool which is more like fountain. If you love jazz and the nighlife, you are really close to Frenchmen Street which is dotted with so many little clubs where the music is jumpin'. This is the best location in NOLA to get around to with ease and no stress. If you need recommendations on where to dine, the woman at the concierge desk is more than helpful to provide excellent places to fill your belly. Also take advantage of the street map provided for coupons on 10% off on Prailines, or 3 dollars off Mardi Gra World and other discounts. I would to stay there again on my next trip to New Orleans. I highly recommend this spot. By the way, this was my third trip to the Big Easy and it gets better each time.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in New Orleans.”
Reviews.Author: jryancb
Reviews.Content: Only steps to Frenchman Street, French Market, French Quarter, Mississippi Riverwalk and Trolley. Friendly staff, secure and quiet property. Kitchenette in room was a plus as well as pool for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: edsej
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for a better location: very close to French Market,French Quarter, Frenchman Street and trolley. Rooms much smaller than I would have liked, can't imagine 4 people staying in the unit we were in, seemed a little crowded for just the 2 of us. Not sure if all rooms are designed this way. Needs some updating of room furniture.Bed was comfortable. Staff was friendly, helpful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locale, Staff Lacking Finesse”
Reviews.Author: BritishAmerican72
Reviews.Content: Right on the southeast corner of the French Market, the location is great for walking the entire French Quarter. However, we took cabs each evening to our restaurant. The hotel is decent, but needs updating. The big let-down was the staff. The front desk clerks were only interested in booking tours for you, as they eagerly claimed that they get a kickback for doing so from the tour operators. When we asked for directions to a close grocery store, we were sent to one a long way away, only later to discover that the owner of the store was friends with the front desk clerk. We later located a grocery store literally around the corner from the hotel. Early one morning, we were awakened by several men yelling at each other about the Saints game the night before. When I went to investigate, it was three of the male staff, standing in the garage directly beneath our room. To summarize, I think we got what we paid for...a cheap hotel in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: abc31
Reviews.Content: I can't say there was anything exceptional about this hotel. It was fine. The beds were comfortable, the shower was hot & enjoyable. The location was good, especially if you want to be in the French Quarter. It is right across the street from the Riverfront streetcar, so it is convenient to get to other parts of the city as well. It is a short walk to restaurants & bars & to the French Market. I don't know what else to say. It didn't excite me, but I there was nothing that would keep me from staying here again if there wasn't a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “It was great coming back to Hotel de la Monnaie at the end of each day!”
Reviews.Author: petunia63
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel de la Monnaie for a week and were so impressed with the staff right from the start. The desk staff welcomed us when we walked in and made us feel comfortable. The gentleman who took our bags up to our room, Wayne, was very informative and friendly. The hotel is just two blocks from the French Market and a short walk to the French Quarter. The room was spotlessly clean and the kitchenette was stocked with everything you would need if you want to prepare a meal "at home". The hotel was very quiet. We never heard any of the other guests and we really enjoyed the inside courtyard and outside balcony. We will definitely stay again at the Hotel de la Monnaie!

Reviews.Title: “hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: arielle90
Reviews.Content: HIDDEN TREASURE We loved it so much we intend to go back every year. We even bought a timeshare there. We came in for Satchmo Festival and low and behold it was across the street at the mint. We just sat half the day on the balcony and listened to the fabulous music. We met a nice lady Carolyn who sold the timeshares she told us about some really great spots to eat. The front desk was professional and helpful. The room made me feel right at home. In fact we intend to go back next month on our owners rate of $45.00 a night. Can you beat that. We are very excited and plan to bring family next year.

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: FloridaJagfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights to celebrate my birthday as well as attend the Satchmo Festival. What a great location to everything. Most everything is within walking distance and a trolley line is across the street. The French Market is two blocks away. Everyone working here treated us great and I can't say enough about Donnie and Camile. They are both so helpful and their recommendations for food and activities were great. Our room was very spacious and also extremely clean. Can't wait until we return to New Orleans as we will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but not enough parking”
Reviews.Author: 8string52
Reviews.Content: As the title says, there is not nearly enough parking. There are 22 spaces in the parking garage. Parking behind the hotel is for the Farmer's Market and runs $18/day. By the way, the entrance to the garage is 7'9", so a conversion van probably won't fit (ours didn't). We had a 2-bedroom suite (through RCI). The living room is a good size, but the bedrooms were a bit smallish. The "kitchen" is nearly non-existant; just a 2-burner electric cooktop, small sink, small fridge and an ancient microwave. There is also a coffeemaker (they provide Community coffee), and a toaster. The bathroom has a whirlpool tub that has very tall sides. The shower is of the type that takes 5 minutes just to get wet. Our suite was on the side with the wading pool, so it was usually pretty noisy in the evenings, until the pool closed at 10pm. There is a nice patio on the second floor, overlooking Esplanade Ave. In the evenings, you can sit on the patio, sip a beverage of your choice, and listen to the music drifting over from nearby clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, great hotel, but Carolyn has to go”
Reviews.Author: Sateslh65
Reviews.Content: My two preschoolers and I tagged along with my husband when he came to New Orleans for a work conference. I found this hotel for us as an alternative to the prescribed conference hotel because we needed extra room for our kids, and I was not disappointed. This hotel consists entirely of suites, and even though we unfortunately chose only a one bedroom, we still had plenty of room. The kids had the front room, sleeping on the pullout sofa and watching their dvd's there, while we had the bedroom where we could watch our own tv after the kids were asleep. The little kitchenette was tiny but serviceable, and the pool on the second level also small but perfect for our kids. The front desk staff were always friendly and had good suggestions for our sightseeing and dinners out. This hotel has an ideal location just off the trolley line by the French Market. We appreciated the free garage parking and the library off the lobby. There is even a washer/dryer on premises. The only drawback was an obnoxious woman named Carolyn who stationed herself in the lobby over the weekend to harass the guests into purchasing a timeshare from this property. She repeatedly called our room and accosted us in the lobby, attempting to ingratiate herself to us, and was absolutely impervious to any evidence of our disinclination to avail ourselves of her services. When I spoke with the front desk clerk about this woman, I learned that she is an independent real estate agent whom the hotel management or board permits to set up station on premises, and they allow her access to our names and room numbers, which felt like an inexcusable invasion of privacy to me. How she manages to coerce any guests into purchasing timeshares with this kind of approach is beyond me. Other than this irritation, our experience in this hotel was very positive, and we will be sure to be back next time we're in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: gabriel97
Reviews.Content: We were guests at Hotel de la Monnaie on June 11 through June 18. The suite was spacious and very clean. Kitchen was well-equipped. The service was great and all employees were very friendly and polite. It was great to have access to a washer and dryer. One of my favorite amenities was the on-site library. Hotel is within walking distance of restaurants and shopping. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans is BACK & HEALTHY & Here's a greaqt place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: lyle4940
Reviews.Content: They should call this place Hotel "Lagniappe", for you surely do get more than you expected! My wife & I stayed at this hotel with a friend from Los Vegas from June 4 to 11 of 2010. What a well kept, pleasant and convenient Hotel this is. The staff is unbelievably courteous and helpful! Donnie, Camille and Delilah are some of the desk people there and I just can't say enough nice things about them! They all went more than the extra mile for each of the guests that asked for their assistance. Each of these people were very knowledgeable about the area and the tours or events and would go out of their way to get any information they lacked. The maid service was right on, everyday and went out of her way to greet us each morning! The rooms were quaint and very roomy and comfortable and nicely furnished with antique pieces as well as jacuzzi tubs and free wi-fi. There were several courtyards, one had a wading pool which we found refreshing after walking all day in the sun. The sound of the water cascading from the urn in the pools center was a very nice touch! The other courtyard was just a very nice quiet place to enjoy the shade of the palms and perhaps read a book and reflect on the days events. The hotel is just one block away from the French Market and we had no problem walking around at any hour of the day or night. I can't count how many times we walked to the Cafe Du Monde from our hotel for Beignetts, sometime twice a day! I would Highly Recommend this Hotel to my closest friends and would rest assured that they would enjoy themselves as much as we did. We're going to stay here each trip to New Orleans from this point on!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and so close to all the best music.”
Reviews.Author: EverywhereAndBack
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really amazing. The rooms were really spacious and would fit families and bigger groups easily (they all have fold out sofas). It amy be a bit pricey for solo travellers like me, but for anything mroe than a person, it's a steal. There were two beuatiful courtyards on the second floor. I recommend you request a room on the second floor so you can go out your door and sit at a tabel sipping your tea or coffee first thing in the morning. There was also a ktichenette to make your own food and a small jaccuzzi bathtub. Event he line of products they had available were great and considerate (nail file, sewing kit, q-tips etc.) There were two t.v.s in my suite and the decoration was really sweet and rustic. If you want something flashy, I don't recommend this place for you. The staff was really friendly. The woman who worked the ngiht shift was a little bit dizzy, but really sweet and helpful nonetheless. The daytime concierge allowed my firend to park there for the day and was really kind about answering questions. Also, most importantly, a 2 minute walk away if the strip of Frenchman street where I saw so many amazing and free live acts. I recommend you bring some small bills to tip the musicians and buy their c.d.s. Most acts were free that night, a few no more than $10. Loved it here. If ever I should come back, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: corkyPhoenix_Az
Reviews.Content: Hotel de la Monnaie is a great hotel and would highly recommend. The location is great. Just a block outside the french quarter so it is peaceful and quiet after a long day. Staff members Camille and Donnie go out of their way to assist you with anything and everything. In fact, I accidently left my coat in the cab on the way to the hotel and the next day Camille tracked down the cab company and was able to get my coat back. Camille is just the best! Only negative on the whole stay was the maintenance. Twice we asked for maintenance to take care of the drain in the tub as we did not like standing in ankle high+ water while taking a shower, but the drain was never taken care of. So, we chose just to let it go instead of keep asking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....Needs an update!!!”
Reviews.Author: LnTluvtravel
Reviews.Content: Came down for Voodoo Experience. Third trip to NOLA in past 3 yrs. Location is excellent,1 block from French Market and across the street from the last stop of the Riverfront Streetcar. Attractive looking property, limited garage parking on first come. first served basis, but free. Not really a problem to park on street. Lovely second story exterior balcony adjacent to atrium with small wading pool and fountain (great spot to soak your feet after traipsing around the city) The room we were in was very small and like a step back into 1985, no, not 1885 but 1985 complete w/ an Amana Radarange (microwave?) that we were able to operate once and then unable to repeat the process ever again. You'd be amazed at how creative you can get w/ a fry pan when you want to reheat your yummy leftovers,as there is no oven in the room. The bedroom was miniscule, it was an odd shape and the bed and dresser were kind of forced to fit in. To get into the bed the only access was from the left side or the foot of the bed after squeezing between the wall and the foot of the bed. We are not large people by an stretch, but the layout was extremely uncomfortable. The furnishings are old and tired, not in a charming antique way, but just old and tired w/ sticking drawers. Once you got into the bed though it was very comfy. My partners major beef was the windows do not open so the only way to get fresh air was to prop front door open. Fortunately this was a timeshare exchange, so we stayed for next to nothing. The hotel personnel were very charming and helpful. The 2 bedroom (we saw from out on the second floor deck) looked great. Very roomy and seemed from what we could see that these had been more recently renovated. If you stay here request a room on two facing Esplanade, all those have room access to the balcony. They are very accommodating to smokers, as they have tables set up all around the atrium on every floor with magazines and ashtrays.Rooms are non-smoking. All in all, I would stay here again, had a great time. But it is what it is. If nothing else the wifi connection was GREAT. No problem connecting or staying connected. We have a Mac, our neighbor had trouble getting on with his pc, don't know if it was just his laptop.

Reviews.Title: “I like this place!”
Reviews.Author: TexasFoodie54
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip here and we enjoyed it as much or more than last year. Excellent location across from the French Market and just across the street from the streetcar stop. Very convenient to several small but good restaurants. Very clean and well maintained. Housekeeping and other staff are all friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed sitting on the 2nd floor terrace over the entrance and "people-watching" on Esplanade Ave., also talking with our fellow guests. Some furniture could use a little updating or replacement, but nothing major.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: billybobpa
Reviews.Content: The best things about the resort were Camille and Donnie of the front desk staff. They were very helpful, friendly and full of advice about N.O., and after 10 minutes with either of them you felt like a family member. Housekeeping, too, was excellent â€“ wish we had gotten the name of the kind and very thorough housekeeper we saw just about every day. We agree with comments about the location so wonâ€™t repeat them â€“ very convenient and just outside the hustle and bustle. The small courtyard fountain wading pool is just that, but it was great for cooling off the blistered dogs after a lot of walking. Itâ€™s deeper than it looks, too. In the evening, grab a chilled brewski (a market a few block down on Esplanade has a small selection) and sit out on the balcony over the main entrance. Breezes are usually nice at that time of evening. This was our first substantial time in New Orleans â€“ my one day drinking blitz while in the Air Force doesnâ€™t count. We didnâ€™t rent a car, based on previous reviews, and really didnâ€™t need one. Took the Airport Shuttle to the resort, and a recommended taxi ride on our way out. We took 3 tours instead renting, which amounted to what we would have paid for a weeks rental. The Hotel de la Monnaie is an excellent place to stay. The hotel was a surprise â€“ very nicely decorated, clean, convenient and not one bug was seen! As for the bed, it was fine. We like firm, and this was somewhat firm, but not stiff as a board as others seem to suggest. Our 1 bedroom was just the right size for the 2 of us. The kitchenette area was definitely small, but worked okay for the re-heating and coffee making. The room was very quiet with the occasional blast of a train whistle. The shower really needed better water pressure, but it was enough to get by. The ice machine (just around the corner outside the room) was great and used a lot, especially for filling the water bottles before heading out for walks and tours. I have to repeat myself and tell you that the front desk staff was excellent. Besides booking the tours and giving us great advice on what to see (and avoid), Donnie kindly did our airport check-in the night before we left. And Camille! The lady is a master baker when it come to bread pudding, which she and her grand-daughter baked to share with us. Did I mention we felt so much like family there?

Reviews.Title: “Laissez les bons temps rouler”
Reviews.Author: Chienfou-n-LatinMama
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in New Orleans with an aunt visiting from France and had a blast. The hotel is in a great location, New Orleans is DEFINITELY open for business, and the weather was superb. Hotel de la Monnaie is a timeshare, and there are even a few left available (at really reasonable rates) as re-sales. It is an urban resort, so the accommodations are not overly large, but HEY, you're in NOLA, what are you doing in your room anyway??! The front desk staff was super, and very well informed. They fielded every question asked and got us an answer if they didn't know one off the top of their heads. We did all the usual things, Court of the Two Sisters, Preservation Hall (sat so close to the band we had to dodge the slide for the trombone), Natchez riverboat trip, Mardi Gras museum, Cafe du Monde for beignets, etc., etc. We found that NOLA is part of the PowerPass system, ( http://www.visiticket.com/NewOrleans/ ) and as such, you can get a really good deal on many of the typical touristy things to do by using the pass. I also highly recommend a day trip to Oak Alley Plantation, and a quick trip to Algiers Point using the (free) ferry as well as the New Orleans School of Cooking where you can watch someone prepare typical NOLA dishes, learn the history of the foods, and then eat the lesson when it's done!! I would not hesitate to stay in the Hotel de la Monnaie again, if the opportunity presents itself, and may even get into the courtyard fountain again... My only regret is that there isn't more parking available, though we were able to park in front of the hotel on the street (free) the few times we couldn't fit in the garage.

Reviews.Title: “Fits the character of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: s2pigeau
Reviews.Content: I had read a few reviews of this hotel and some folks made comments that it needed to be updated. Not at all, it is an older hotel that has the charm and character of the French Quarter. Really friendly employees. Nice courtyard in the center of the hotel. Free internet service that wasn't slow and worked well throughout the facility. The rooms are 1 & 2 bedroom suites and were really nice. I didn't find the mattress too hard either as some previous reviewers had said. We really enjoyed our time at this hotel. Only downside: it was too hot in the small exercise room.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for more...”
Reviews.Author: ajalvaro2003
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean & comfortable. The Staff was EXCELLENT. Located by the F.Q., & very interesting places to eat in the immediatet areaAREA. Easy access to many things to do...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service near the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: tony1usa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and found it to be the perfect location to explore the French Market, French Quarter and the trendy Faubourg Marigny section of town. The room was well appointed and offered value for the cost. Sure, it is not a deluxe hotel but it was homey and friendly. In fact, Mr. Donald Griffin, one of the front desk concierges made our stay fun by offering interesting and well-thought out attractions and restaurants. The parking lot was small but we always found space in or near the hotel. A couple of times, we decided to use the trolley that runs along the river since the last stop is near the hotel. It dropped us off near the River Walk, Aquarium, casino and back at the hotel. This is a huge convenience since there was no parking issues (and cost) to worry about if you are traveling to that part of the Quarter. The hotel can stand to upgrade some amenities but, once again, if you are looking for value on the other side of the Quarter, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: trinitee24
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel with my son and daughter-in-law, via their time share. We found the hotel to be quiet and clean, with a staff that goes "above and beyond" and made our stay wonderful! The day we checked in, we found there was a problem with the sofa bed in our suite. The manager took care of us immediately, and ended up giving us a 2nd suite for our stay. You couldn't ask for more than that! We loved that the hotel was on the outskirts of the French Quarter, so while everything was in walking distance, the hotel was quiet and peaceful. We all really enjoyed the our time in New Orleans, and would stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Experience”
Reviews.Author: SaintSaTionAl
Reviews.Content: Born New Orleanian now on Northshore stayed at Hotel de la Monnaie during Mardi Gras 2008 and had a fabulous time, hotel and staff were great. Had to park behind building in lot on Esplanade, but it was inexpensive and short walk. Hope to stay there again this Mardi Gras 2009. Recommended to everyone I know. The interior courtyard and balconies are great. The guests were great, all ages. The 1 bedroom suite we had was great with great views.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JoshuaLouis
Reviews.Content: I grew up in the Bywater neighborhood of New Orleans, but have long since moved to DC. When I come home I always stay at the De La Monnaie because it's right between the Quarters and the Marigny. Free parking is rare, and even though the rooms are too small for 6, there's more than ample room for 2-4 people. I always recommend DLM to those who want to experience NOLA and not spend their entire vacation swilling hand grenades and passing out with the gutter punks in Jackson Square!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!! Small rooms & rude staff...”
Reviews.Author: Olgaitaly
Reviews.Content: I booked a week at this hotel thru my timeshare company for my family during Christmas week. I felt so bad because this was possibly one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed at. I had a 2 bedroom apartment that would sleep 6 people. First of all, this apartment, unit #412, is way too small for 6 people! You can't even walk around the living room with the sofa bed pulled out. It was very cramped. Also, the closet space for 6 people is non existent. Secondly, our shower didn't work properly. We reported it our 2nd morning there, but it was never fixed. We had to wash our hair using a glass from the cupboard. We asked for another room, but they said that they were booked up. Thirdly, the staff was soooo rude! We had to deal with Steve (a night shift person) and when we asked if we could have a late checkout on Friday, he flat out said "no". He didn't even want to give us a reason as to why until we probed him a little more. Even with all of our troubles, he was completely unsympathetic and said he couldn't do it. It was only till we spoke with the women who took over his shift at night, that she gave us a late check out (still huffing and puffing as she agreed to it). Fourthly, I room was only cleaned 2x in 7 days, even when we asked the cleaning lady to come in and clean it. This was just a miserable experience!!! If you plan to have more than 3 people with you in the hotel room, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Hilton, but a cozy, quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: SKPA
Reviews.Content: We booked as an Extra Vacation through RCI and got an excellent rate -- less than $450 for 7 nights. For such a great price, we weren't expecting much. The hotel was much better than we had anticipated. Yes, it is outdated. Yes, the beds are a bit firm. Yes, it's kind of dark. Yes, it's not in the heart of the FQ. But yes, if you get a good deal, it's a gem in NOLA. We found most of the workers to be extremely nice. The person at the front desk was so nice to upgrade our room when we had paid for an extremely small room (hence, the deal we got). The cleaning staff was great, especially since NOLA required us to do a lot of sleeping in (still cleaned the room when we didn't leave until the afternoon). The jacuzzi tub wasn't the best but did its job. The pool in November was gated off, but wouldn't have been interested anyway. However, the mini-kitchen was enough for us to keep some bottled waters and leftovers and make some coffee. We got daily maid service even though we were on a timeshare, which was great. We found the hotel quaint, the workers nice, and the other owners we met were very nice as well. We were asked about purchasing a timeshare and couldn't do it, but we did get the information to pass on to some family and friends. The location is great, in my opinion. It is only a 10-minute walk to the middle of the FQ. Just head down Decatur to Cafe du Monde! We didn't explore it, but the Marigny is right near the hotel, as well as the French Market and Louisiana Pizza Kitchen, as someone else already mentioned. Don't expect a Hilton with numerous amenities and wait staff. If that's what you're looking for, go elsewhere. But if you're looking for a clean, small little hotel not in the middle of party central (party central is still close to get to), then this is a good choice. If you can get a decent rate, it's a pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another great week!”
Reviews.Author: alaynadea
Reviews.Content: Hotel de la Monnaie has two very important things going for it. Parking and location. The parking is in a garage which is gated at night. Parking in the garage is FREE! Free parking in the French Quarter! Amazing! The location of the hotel is fantastic. There is a street car stop right across the street. The French Market is a block away! The hotel is on Esplanade street, which has an exit off highway 10, so it's easy to access if you are driving. The decor in the rooms is a little dated. And the beds are a firm. BUT, everything is very clean. The bathrooms in the two rooms I've stayed in have both been very large, which is great. I love having a bedroom and living room to lounge in after a long day of walking around NOLA. The best deals on this hotel can be found if you are a time share owner looking to buy an escape week. We bought 7 nights at this property for under $400. At one point, we were called on our hotel phone and asked if we'd like to buy our own week at Hotel de la Monnaie. The deal was great and frankly, I was very tempted, but I said no. The lady was very chill about it, no hard sell here, and we were not asked again the rest of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the de la Monnaie”
Reviews.Author: AnninAZ
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel de la Monnaie through Interval and we thought we'd give it a try while we attended a conference in New Orleans. This place was a perfect location and it definitely beat staying downtown at the Hilton with the rest of the attendees. We were right on the edge of the French Quarter withing walking distance of the whole area. The location on Esplanade is more of a residential area so you are near the fun but far enough away to enjoy some quiet downtime. We loved the trolly car right across the street and we took that down to the conference center for the conference days we attended. We also took it up Canal Street and nearly delivered to the WWII museum. From there we were able to catch a ride to the Garden District - a must see if you love old architecture - beautiful old homes(mansions). We at lunch ate Joey K's there and it was excellent. We ate so many places in the French Quarter I can't remember all the names. My husband loved all the NOL foods - gumbo, jambalya and more. I'm glad we found the Louisiana Pizza Kitchen right on the other side of the U.S. Mint (across the street from Monnaie). Small little spot but excellent pizza! The day we arrived was a huge jazz festival going on across the street. However, once in our rooms, you couldn't hear any outside noise. Just the train at night blowin it's whistle! We enjoyed being so close to the French Market and within walking distance of all the sites to see. And you can't pass up the Cafe du Monde down the street - a busy happenning place with the best French dougnuts!!!Delicious! We will defintely come back and would stay here again. We were not hounded to purchase anything. My husband only received one phone call regarding timeshare and the woman was very pleasant. The staff was laid back and friendly. My only complaint was the very firm bed. Other than that, we really enjoyed our stay. Thanks Hotel de la Monnaie!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs updating”
Reviews.Author: adshansel
Reviews.Content: This location cannot be beat. You are right on the edge of the French Quarter, but not in the craziness of it all. Everything is walking distance and if you don't want to walk, the street car is right there. The neighborhood is also nice, I think it is coming back. The units are dated. They suffice, but with a little money put into each unit, they could be much nicer. They were very clean and we had maid service everyday even though we were on a timeshare. The service was excellent, we never had a problem and we were always greeted when we entered and exited. There is not always parking available in the garage, but there is a lot very close and street parking right out in front, usually. The building is beautiful with two courtyards and table and chairs outside the units. Overall, very, very good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It So Much We Got A Timeshare”
Reviews.Author: mellygirl1962
Reviews.Content: A friend of ours has a timeshare at this hotel that he wasn't able to use in January, 2007. He offered it to my (then fiance) and myself. We took him up on the offer and decided to get married while we were there. We had a wonderful time! The rooms aren't terribly large, but they are clean and well kept. There's a refrigerator big enough to hold leftovers and sodas, a microwave and a coffee pot, along with a little sink. I liked that there was a couch and tv watching area that was separate from the bedroom. The bed was comfortable and the staff was pleasant. They consistently helped us find our way to different things we wanted to do and had great advice for us. We also really like that the parking is indoors and secured. We rarely took the car out, anyway. We just walked everywhere. They offered a GREAT deal on a timeshare that our friend shared with us and we snapped it up. We'll be going back every year (unless we want to trade with another property) and are looking forward to it. It's not a place to be rowdy, but it is quietly elegant and a little old fashioned, yet relaxed enough we can be ourselves. Probably not the choice for kids looking for nightlife (thankfully!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Cose to everything!”
Reviews.Author: wanttotravelIllinois
Reviews.Content: We booked a 1 bedroom for a week in July 2007. The room was well kept and had enough space for 2 adults and an active toddler. We were able to watch tv and relax in our bedroom after we put the baby to sleep in the living room. The living room was large enough so that we could set up our portable crib in the corner. Hotel de la Monnaie is right off the French Quarter and close to the street car line. It has a nice wading pool and a deck off the second floor where you can look out on the street. There are 2 courtyards that add nice local flavor to the hotel. The suite also had a small kitchenette- and there are several small grocery and liquor stores near by to stock up. I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “great NOLA experience”
Reviews.Author: JeanaNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel de la Monnaie for a week. The hotel and staff was fantastic! The second floor, with it's garden atrium, balcony, and "wading" pool, was so pretty to come back to each day. The reviews I read did not do the hotel justice. When we go back to New Orleans, this will be the place we'll stay. Location was the best in NO! Extremely helpful and friendly staff. Just can't say enough good things about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “you can do better”
Reviews.Author: NanKansas
Reviews.Content: fantastic location, steps from the streetcar and the great little shops on decatur. the property itself really needs overhauled. furniture is old and broken down (except for the bed - nice mattress) and the bath is in dire need of updating. dirty, cracked, stained tub, barely enough water pressure for a decent shower (though this may not be their fault) the staff was generally polite with a few unhelpful exceptions. i did not expereince a staff that goes out of their way to enhance my stay, like other travellers. whether you're time-sharing or not, you can do better than this hotel. it was not a nice place to stay at all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vapetlover
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through RCI. There were usual problems with an old hotel, but the employees went out of their way to make sure our needs were met. The owner even loaned me his old walking cane due to some problems I was having with a bad knee. When I couldn't easily get into the tub/shower, they provided a step stool. When lights were out, they replaced them immediately. This is not a glitzy hotel, but if you're willing to enjoy the ambience of "old N.O." then this might be perfect. We were across the street from the trolley stop which was convenient and fun. We didn't even rent a car to get around and never missed it.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Quiet Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel de la Monaie is part of the old Federal mint located on the edge of the French Quarter in New Orleans. It's a small hotel, but the suites (yes, suites, not rooms) are impressive and the rates are right in line with the rest of the French Quarter (better actually when you consider that you are getting a suite for the same money other places charge for a room). The hotel was not damaged in any way during Hurricane Katrina and has been re-opened for business since late November 2005. The location is ideal. You may participate in as much or as little of the French Quarter as you want. And, at the end of the evening, it's a quiet retreat where the over-zealous party go-er can get plenty of sleep. The staff is outstanding. During Katrina, the concierge (Susan Doucette)oversaw the safety of the staff (most of whom lost their homes in the 9th Ward and evacuated to the Hotel)and the safety of the few foolish out-of-towners who decided to "ride out the storm" without realizing that they were putting others in harms way -- not just themselves.

Reviews.Title: “THis was one of many times I've stayed, and it just gets better and better.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at de la Monnaie many times and enjoy it each time. The staff is constantly looking for ways to improve the already good facility. It's so nice to find new adventures in the neighborhood. Like jazz, good ecclectic food, art studios, flea markets, antiques, people watching? All are found in abundance a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from New Orleans and this Hotel was great. Be careful, you may have a new addition in 9 months after staying here..

Reviews.Title: “Nice Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chillichilli
Reviews.Content: Good location, friendly staff and an ideal place for a holiday. would return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice place, close to Bourbon Street, shops, river, etc. without the noise. Close to several good restuarants, and the French Market.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location! Our family has stayed twice here & has come away delighted each time. It's across the street from the Farmers Market, old Mint (now a museum), & the Riverwalk, & around the corner from a great jazz bar. 2 blocks to the French Quarter. Very friendly & responsive staff, a small kitchen for those saving bucks by doing some cooking, an open air courtyard with a small wading pool. Get your food from the Market or 2 blocks away at a grocery store.Excellent price for a suite!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel de la Monnaie
HotelInfo.Address: 405 Esplanade Ave., New Orleans, LA 70116
